newsitem.title: USA: SIMON DEBARTOLO ACQUIRES 50 PCT OF FLORIDA MALL.
newsitem.headline: SIMON DEBARTOLO ACQUIRES 50 PCT OF FLORIDA MALL.

text.p: Simon DeBartolo Group Inc said Monday it has acquired 50 percent interest in Dadeland Mall, a 1.4 million square foot super-regional mall located in Miami, Florida.
The purchase was made for an undisclosed amount of cash and Simon DeBartolo stock, said the real estate investment trust which owns and operates regional malls and community shopping centers.

The ownership interest in Dadeland was purchased from Prime Property Fund, a $2.7 billion pooled real estate account for pension fund investors managed by ERE Yarmouth. Prime Property Fund will continue to hold the remaining 50 percent ownership interest. Simon DeBartolo Group will assume primary management, leasing and development responsibilities for the mall effective immediately, the company said
Total 1996 sales at the mall were in excess of $515 million and small shop sales of $649 per square foot, the company said.
Plans have been developed for a major expansion and redevelopment of Dadeland Mall, the company said.
A $12 million redevelopment program to improve access and circulation at the property will be completed in the fall of this year, the company said.
Simon DeBartolo shares closed Friday at 31-7/16.
